name: Jamf Pro Dark Mode
description: GitHub Source Now that MacOS has a native dark mode, I think Jamf deserves one, too! I have spent 20+ hours combing through page after page of the Jamf Pro console and adjusting the colors to create a general 'dark mode' theme. My changes affect the text weight and colors, backgrounds, the dashboard, lists, tables, sidebars, policies, inventory, assistants, dialog boxes, buttons, checkboxes, search bars, alerts, and for multiple event states (normal, disabled, hover, focus, active). There is a mild contrast improvement. Feel free to submit additional changes to the source code on GitHub. Please leave a comment so I know why you've edited that particular section. This is my first attempt at anything approaching "web front-end" anything in over 15 years, so please be kind.
additional_info:
INSTALLATION NOTES - PLEASE READ:

1. Click "Show CSS Code" above.
2. Open the Stylish extension menu.
3. Click the ellipses menu > Manage All Styles.
4. Find the Jamf Pro style and click the 'edit' button.
5. At the bottom of the page, find 'Applies to URLs on the domain.'
6. Change the values from 'jss.pretendco.com' to match your JSS domain.
7. Click 'Save' at the top.
8. Enjoy!

Note: Stylish is not available for Safari at this time, as are most user-script and CSS override extensions.
